pageContext.claim: “We will save perhaps $900 billion....I'm saving a tremendous amount — hundreds and hundreds of millions of dollars we're saving on health care.”
pageContext.analysis: The nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office report on the Republican bill said it would reduce the deficit by $337 billion over the next decade. Trump appears to be referring to a $900 billion reduction in revenue from the repeal of Obamacare taxes, but that’s actually money lost to the federal government. The proposed law would have reduced federal spending on health care by $1.2 trillion but the repeal in taxes means the impact on the budget is significantly smaller.
